info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 5:21PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SCREVEN, BULLOCH, EFFINGHAM, HAMPTON AND JASPER COUNTIES... At 520 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Leefield to near Egypt to near Pineora, and moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and up to penny sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Statesboro, Springfield, Rincon, Guyton, Brooklet, Newington, Oliver and Ebenezer. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
